question: [File: aptos-core/consensus/src/pipeline/execution_schedule_phase.rs] [Function: process()] [Block tampering] When receiving ExecutionRequest, is there cryptographic verification that ordered_blocks haven't been tampered with since ordering phase? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/pipeline/execution_schedule_phase.rs] [Function: process()] [Size limits] Is there a maximum size limit on ordered_blocks vector to prevent memory exhaustion attacks, or can arbitrarily large vectors be passed? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/pipeline/execution_schedule_phase.rs] [Function: process()] [Spawn bomb] Can a Byzantine validator cause many ExecutionRequests to be created simultaneously, spawning unbounded futures and exhausting async runtime resources? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/pipeline/execution_schedule_phase.rs] [Function: process()] [Hash collision] When using block.id() for block_id at line 54, if two blocks have colliding HashValues, can this cause blocks to be confused or incorrectly executed? (Critical)
